Vocabularies.Definition: n. 门闩
(of a door) closed but not locked （门）关着但没上锁
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Don't forget to leave the front door on the latch if you go to bed before I come back.

Vocabularies.Definition: shut (sth.) esp. temporarily （尤指暂时）关闭
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. On the New Year's Eve all the stores were closed up in my hometown.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. of, in or suggesting the countryside 农村的；有乡村特点的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. In rural areas the distance between buildings makes infrastructure development costly.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. unfasten the lock of (a door, etc.) 开（门等）的锁
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. He unlocked the car and threw his coat on to the back seat.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  exposed to danger or attack; unprotected 易受攻击的；无防御的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Intruders are developing techniques to harness the power of hundreds of thousands of vulnerable systems on the Internet.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 巡查严密的 patrol v. go round (a town, an area, etc.) to check that all is secure and orderly 巡逻；巡查
a.  of, situated in or living in a city or town 城市的，都市的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Motor vehicle emissions, to a large extent, are responsible for urban air pollution.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. collection of information expressed in numbers 统计；统计资料
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The US Immigration and Naturalization Service said government statistics on foreign workers were incomplete.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. 显著地；戏剧性地 dramatic  a.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. At speeds above 50mph, serious injuries dramatically increase.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.  据称 allege vt.  state (sth.) as a fact but without proof 宣称，声称 e.g. His car allegedly struck the two kids as they were crossing the street.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  calm, quiet and undisturbed 平静的；宁静的 e.g. Visitors like to stay in this hotel because it is beautiful and located in a tranquil lake area.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 纪元；年代；时代 e.g. The dinosaurs（恐龙）died out about 66 million years ago, at the end of the Mesozoic Era（中生代）.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. keyed lock with steel bolts that extend one or two inches into the door frame （钢栓式）防盗门 bolt n.（门、窗等的）闩
a.  电子的 e.g. The increasing globalization of the electronic marketplace offers opportunities for businesses and consumers in terms of both access and choice.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 触发式报警装置；（陷阱的）绊索
connect or attach (sth.) to (sth. else) with or as if with a hook 连接到
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. My computer is hooked up to the Internet, so I can communicate with my students at home via email.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  露台，平台
ad.  tastefully, stylishly 优雅地，高雅地 elegant  a.
make (sth.) as part of the structure 使成为建筑物的一部分
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The cupboards in the kitchen are all built in.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  撬开；撬动
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Her car trunk had been pried open and all her equipment was gone.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. 用浆糊粘贴 n. 浆糊；糊状物
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The protesters had pasted slogans all over the walls.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (pl.) （包括地基在内的）房屋；假设，前提
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The shop sells food but doesn't allow it to be eaten on the premises.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 监视
n. 广告
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Tobacco advertisements have been banned from TV for several years.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. 给……以显著地位，突出；由……主演
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Modern libraries often feature telecommunications links that provide users with access to information at remote sites.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 图表，示意图
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The nurse gave the doctor a chart showing the patient's temperature and blood pressure.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  挂锁；扣锁
n. (infml) 广告
a. 精神的；心灵的；心理的
n.  改变，转变 transform vt.  change completely in form, appearance, or nature 改变，转变
build or erect 建造，设置
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Most of the old buildings were pulled down so that blocks of apartments could be put up.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. thing that prevents progress or movement 障碍；妨碍
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The driver slowed down as he approached the police barrier.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. 在……设置路障 n. 路障，街垒
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Terrified villagers have barricaded themselves into their houses.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.  move about without a fixed purpose 漫游；闲逛；徘徊
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Many people from the rural areas wandered from town to town looking for work.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. （使用）X射线的
（飞机等）起飞
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The plane didn't take off on time because of the heavy storm.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 恐怖主义者；恐怖分子 terror n. 恐怖；恐怖的事
prevent (an enemy, pursuers, etc.) from coming near 不让……逼近
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. She left the light on at night to keep her fears at bay.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  搜身器；搜查器
with not even 甚至连…… 都没……
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. She auctioned off the car without so much as taking a ride in it.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad., a. to, towards or from the side 斜着（的）；斜向一边（的）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Alfred shot him a sideways glance.

Vocabularies.Definition: represent; mean 代表；表示，象征
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. That newspaper is often thought to stand for freedom of speech.

Vocabularies.Definition: cover or envelop as if with liquid 沉浸于，沐浴于
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The fields and woods were bathed in a golden light at sunrise.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. 分析；解析；研究
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Assemble your knowledge and analyze it: that is the way forward.

Vocabularies.Definition: 小/大幅度地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Governor Bush won the election but by a small margin.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 错误；差错；误差
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I was guilty of making an error of judgment.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. not safe or protected 不安全的，不可靠的 secure a. 安全的，可靠的
vt. cause to improve from a primitive stage of human society to a more developed one 开化；使文明
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The terrorist attack on the World Trade Center has shocked the civilized world.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a thing bringing discredit or criticism; reflecting or being reflected 有损声誉（或受指责）的事；思考；反映
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The fact that we all failed the test was a reflection on our teacher.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 令人困惑的；令人费解的 puzzle v.（使）迷惑；（使）窘困
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. I found that English film very puzzling.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 家庭主妇
n. 强奸（罪） vt. 强奸
n. 哨子
n. 自我保护；自我防卫 protection n. 保护；防卫
have one's efforts at cunning or cleverness result in one's own disadvantage 聪明反被聪明误 outsmart vt. 比……精明；智胜
n. 邪恶；灾祸
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Everybody is aware of the evils of alcohol.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 遗产；传留下来的东西
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. You could make a real difference in someone's life by leaving them a generous legacy.

Vocabularies.Definition: think about (sth.) in one's past 回顾
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. When you look back on your life, what moments would you cherish the most?
